author: deme1744
content:
Note for others implementing the new Portal history network (https://github.com/ethereum/portal-network-specs/blob/master/history/history-network.md):
The new specs refer to the receipts as defined in the devp2p/eth specifications.
And there there was a change made to receipts for eth/69: https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/bc76b9809a30e6dc5c8dcda996273f0f9bcf7108/caps/eth.md#eth69-eip-7642-april-2025

This is different of what we were using as RLP encoding for Receipts in the now called legacy history network. So heads up on this.

author: deme1744
content:
This does make me realize that this also differs from what was done in era1 files.
While the spec (https://github.com/eth-clients/e2store-format-specs/blob/main/formats/era1.md) does not specifically mention which encoding / typing of Receipts to use, it dates from before this eth/69 change, which means the previous typing (this is at least how we got it implemented in Nimbus and I did compare with geth implementation while the original geth PR was up).

I do think it would make sense to align these, but of course era1 files are already in existence....
<@543900561460822016>

author: deme1744
content: Looking at the new EraE proposal I did notice that this got addressed.

author: lightclient
content: Yes I think the plan is to deprecate `era1` with `eraE` going forward, which does modify the receipt format to match eth/69
